node.title: Southern California to see record-breaking heat on Super Bowl Sunday
node.description: Sunday's game could be the hottest kick-off in all of Super Bowl history.
node.content: ["A high pressure winter heat wave in Southern California is forecast to lash Los Angeles with unseasonably hot temperatures on Super Bowl Sunday, according to the National Weather Service Prediction Center. It could be the hottest kick-off in all of Super Bowl history, according to\u00a0CBS Los Angeles.\u00a0", "Los Angeles is forecast to see temperatures near 90 degrees Sunday, when the Los Angeles Rams take on the Cincinnati Bengals at SoFi Stadium. The NWS has issued heat advisories for Los Angeles County, including portions of downtown Los Angeles, until 6 p.m. local time.\u00a0", "Excited for the Superbowl!? \ud83c\udfc8 It will be unseasonably hot at the game, with highs near 90 in LA! Much of the western U.S. will see above normal temperatures. A good day to stay inside and eat your favorite snacks in the East, with colder temps and snow showers in the forecast. pic.twitter.com/h4rJqWACXR", "Michael Rogers, who helped design SoFi Stadium, said its roof will provide shade for fans at Sunday's game, and its 16 massive operable panels should help to alleviate heat, according to CBS Los Angeles.\u00a0", "The hot temperatures are forecast to be accompanied by offshore winds, which have helped increase temperatures over recent days, the NWS\u00a0reports. Over the last 24 hours, areas throughout Los Angeles County and the San Fernando Valley have seen\u00a0wind gusts up to 45 mph.", "The heat and strong winds bring an elevated threat of wildfire activity and heat-related illnesses for people in the area, the NWS warned. Those under heat advisories are encouraged to stay hydrated and out of the sun in air-conditioned rooms.", "\"Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke,\" the weather agency\u00a0said Saturday. \"Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency!\"", "The heatwave has already\u00a0broken\u00a0local temperature records and\u00a0sparked\u00a0brush fires. On Saturday, temperatures at Los Angeles International Airport, which is just about 4 miles from SoFi Stadium, reached a record 89 degrees Fahrenheit.\u00a0", "By Monday, temperatures throughout the region are expected to cool down, as a cold storm makes its way through the Pacific Northwest, the NWS said. There's a slight chance of light rain showers rain and mountain showers, along with gusty winds, as the storm arrives on Tuesday.\u00a0", "Tori B. Powell is a breaking news reporter at CBS News. Reach her at tori.powell@viacomcbs.com"]
